column4: mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sda1,
missing codepage or helper program, or other error
In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
dmesg | tail or so
bad mount command arguments most likely
how do i correct this?  i have all the backup files on this partition
anyway to fix this?
i've tried testdisk and other tools not sure how to fix it...
fix what?  if you use spaces in a directory name you MUST quote the paths or escape the spaces.. thats BASH basics...
oope wrong person. :) heh
lol
i mean the messed up partition :P
use proper mount options/arguments..
how do you even know its messed up? what filesystem is it?
jfs   well im not sure if its messed up but i cannt mout it :(
clarify what you have exactly... and what you mean by 'run'
install it
if you mean 'copy it to a hard drive' you can do that via 'dd' and the proper options. but it may need more work afterwords to be a working system
dd?
it installs to the system in the proper directories where it belongs..
if you cant find its icon. run it via terminal
run it from terminal. your menus havent refreshed most likely
'gksudo gparted'  it has to be ran as root anyway
you may want to clarify your 'needs' and let us suggest what you should be doing.
